parameters.name: name
parameters.description: object name

parameters.name: refers_to
parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that refers to another Avi resource. Its syntax is refers_to=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all virtual services referring to pool p1 will be refers_to=pool:pool_p1_uuid

parameters.name: referred_by
parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that are referred by another Avi resource. Its syntax is referred_by=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all pools referred_by virtual service vs1 - referred_by=virtualservice:vs_vs1_uuid

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: List of fields to be returned for the resource. Some fields like name, URL, uuid etc. are always returned.

parameters.name: include_name
parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.

parameters.name: skip_default
parameters.description: Default values are not set.

parameters.name: join_subresources
parameters.description: It automatically returns additional dependent resources like runtime. Eg. join_subresources=runtime.

parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant
parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header

parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant-UUID
parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header UUID

parameters.name: X-Avi-Version
parameters.description: The caller is required to set Avi Version Header to the expected version of configuration. The response from the controller will provide and accept data according to the specified version. The controller will reject POST and PUT requests where the data is not compatible with the specified version.

parameters.name: X-CSRFToken
parameters.description: Avi Controller may send back CSRF token in the response cookies. The caller should update the request headers with this token else controller will reject requests.

parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant
parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header

parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant-UUID
parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header UUID

version.description: Protobuf version number. Gets incremented if there is se Diff of federated diff in config pbs.This field will be a monotonically increasing number indicating the number of Config Update operations. Field introduced in 21.1.1.

key.description: Key for filter match. Field introduced in 20.1.3.

values.description: Values for filter match. Multiple values will be evaluated as OR. Example  key = value1 OR key = value2. Behavior for match is key = * if this field is empty. Field introduced in 20.1.3.

autoscaling_duration.description: Scheduled autoscale duration (in hours). Allowed values are 1-24. Field introduced in 21.1.1. Unit is HOURS.

cron_expression.description: The cron expression describing desired time for the scheduled autoscale. Field introduced in 21.1.1.

desired_capacity.description: Desired number of servers during scheduled intervals, it may cause scale-in or scale-out based on the value. Field introduced in 21.1.1.

enable.description: Enables the scheduled autoscale. Field introduced in 21.1.1.

end_date.description: Scheduled autoscale end date in ISO8601 format, said day will be included in scheduled and have to be in future and greater than start date. Field introduced in 21.1.1.

recurrence.description: Deprecated.Frequency of the Scheduled autoscale. Enum options - ONCE, EVERY_DAY, EVERY_WEEK, EVERY_MONTH. Field deprecated in 21.1.3. Field introduced in 21.1.1.

schedule_max_step.description: Maximum number of simultaneous scale-in/out servers for scheduled autoscale. If this value is 0, regular autoscale policy dictates this. . Field introduced in 21.1.1.

start_date.description: Scheduled autoscale start date in ISO8601 format, said day will be included in scheduled and have to be in future. Field introduced in 21.1.1.

_last_modified.description: UNIX time since epoch in microseconds. Units(MICROSECONDS).

configpb_attributes.description: Protobuf versioning for config pbs. Field introduced in 21.1.1.

delay_for_server_garbage_collection.description: Delay in minutes after which a down server will be removed from Pool. Value 0 disables this functionality. Field introduced in 20.1.3.

description.description: User defined description for the object.

intelligent_autoscale.description: Use Avi intelligent autoscale algorithm where autoscale is performed by comparing load on the pool against estimated capacity of all the servers.

intelligent_scalein_margin.description: Maximum extra capacity as percentage of load used by the intelligent scheme. Scale-in is triggered when available capacity is more than this margin. Allowed values are 1-99.

intelligent_scaleout_margin.description: Minimum extra capacity as percentage of load used by the intelligent scheme. Scale-out is triggered when available capacity is less than this margin. Allowed values are 1-99.

labels.description: Key value pairs for granular object access control. Also allows for classification and tagging of similar objects. Field deprecated in 20.1.5. Field introduced in 20.1.3. Maximum of 4 items allowed.

markers.description: List of labels to be used for granular RBAC. Field introduced in 20.1.5. Allowed in Basic edition, Essentials edition, Enterprise edition.

max_scalein_adjustment_step.description: Maximum number of servers to scale-in simultaneously. The actual number of servers to scale-in is chosen such that target number of servers is always more than or equal to the min_size.

max_scaleout_adjustment_step.description: Maximum number of servers to scale-out simultaneously. The actual number of servers to scale-out is chosen such that target number of servers is always less than or equal to the max_size.

max_size.description: Maximum number of servers after scale-out. Allowed values are 0-400.

min_size.description: No scale-in happens once number of operationally up servers reach min_servers. Allowed values are 0-400.

scalein_alertconfig_refs.description: Trigger scale-in when alerts due to any of these Alert configurations are raised. It is a reference to an object of type AlertConfig.

scalein_cooldown.description: Cooldown period during which no new scale-in is triggered to allow previous scale-in to successfully complete. Unit is SEC.

scaleout_alertconfig_refs.description: Trigger scale-out when alerts due to any of these Alert configurations are raised. It is a reference to an object of type AlertConfig.

scaleout_cooldown.description: Cooldown period during which no new scale-out is triggered to allow previous scale-out to successfully complete. Unit is SEC.

scheduled_scalings.description: Scheduled-based scale-in/out policy. During scheduled intervals, metrics based autoscale is not enabled and number of servers will be solely derived from ScheduleScale policy. Field introduced in 21.1.1. Maximum of 1 items allowed.

tenant_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type Tenant.

use_predicted_load.description: Use predicted load rather than current load.

uuid.description: Unique object identifier of the object.
